discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment: Just one littlle remark, I am not a big fan of using ```N``` as a separator (```hasNfind``` and ```memNindex```) I think I find ```hasN_find``` and ```memN_index``` like in ```ifN_eq``` more legible

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> Just one littlle remark, I am not a big fan of using `N` as a separator (`hasNfind` and `memNindex`) I think I find `hasN_find` and `memN_index` like in `ifN_eq` more legible

I guess that is a matter of taste, and mine is I like it better in the current way. Furthermore, it seems that the most wide spread convention is to use it as a separator as in `gtnNdvd`, `ltnNge`, `gtNdvdp` and at least 8 other occurrences of this kind... (cf `grep -e "[a-z0-9]N[a-z0-9]" **/*.v | grep "Lemma"` filtering out the numerous examples where  `N` is not a separtor) while the example you cite has exactly two occurences `ifN_eq` and `ifN_eqC`.

discussion.author: thery
discussion.comment:
as there are so few occurrences we can still go either ways :smile:
Maybe we can merge this pull request and leave the N as an issue for later

commits.author: CohenCyril
commits.message: Added lemmas about foldl, scanl, foldr and rcons and cons
